question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure that the generated code is executable for display. Please generate an SVG information card based on the user's content with the following characteristics:

# Basic Layout:
- Canvas size: 800x500
- Background: White (#ffffff), 15px rounded corners
- Padding: Light gray background (#f8f9fa), 10px margin, 10px rounded corners, light gray border (#e9ecef)

# Title Section:
- Position: Top left (40, 50)
- Font: Arial, 24px, bold
- Color: Google Blue (#1a73e8)
- Divider line below

# Content Cards:
- Generate reasonable card types, quantity, and layout based on content, without overlapping
- Card background: Light blue (#e8f0fe)
- Rounded corners: 8px
- Content padding: 20px
- Title: 18px, bold, with emoji icon
- Body text: 14px, dark gray (#202124)

# Bottom Signature:
- Left side: Date
- Right side: Author signature: Panda Jay
- Font: Arial, 14px
- Color: Gray (#5f6368)

# Color Scheme:
- Primary color: #1a73e8 (Google Blue)
- Background: #ffffff (White)
- Card: #e8f0fe (Light blue)
- Border: #e9ecef (Light gray)
- Text: #202124 (Dark gray)

# Notes:
1. All text should use Arial font
2. Titles should be paired with appropriate emojis
3. Content should wrap automatically based on length
4. Maintain consistent spacing and whitespace
5. Content must not overlap or obscure other elements

# Initialization:
Now ask the user what content they would like to generate as a card.

checklist.title: Is the SVG information card basic layout properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG canvas is correctly sized at 800x500, has a white background (#ffffff) with 15px rounded corners, and includes the specified padding with light gray background (#f8f9fa), 10px margin, 10px rounded corners, and light gray border (#e9ecef). Inspect the SVG viewBox attribute and root element styling. Score 0 if basic layout is missing, 5 if partially implemented with incorrect dimensions or styling, and 10 if fully implemented according to specifications.

checklist.title: Is the title section correctly positioned and styled?
checklist.description: Verify that the title is positioned at top left (40, 50), uses Arial font at 24px bold, is colored in Google Blue (#1a73e8), and has a divider line below it. Check SVG text element attributes and styling. Deduct 2 points if position is incorrect, 2 points if font styling is wrong, 2 points if color doesn't match specifications, and 4 points if divider line is missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the content cards properly designed and laid out?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the content cards have light blue background (#e8f0fe), 8px rounded corners, 20px content padding, 18px bold titles with emoji icons, and 14px dark gray (#202124) body text. Check for proper spacing and no overlapping elements. Deduct 3 points for missing card styling, 3 points for incorrect text formatting, and 4 points if cards overlap or are poorly arranged. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the bottom signature section implemented correctly?
checklist.description: Check if the bottom signature includes date on the left side and 'Panda Jay' author signature on the right side, with Arial 14px font in gray (#5f6368) color. Verify proper positioning and alignment. Deduct 5 points if either date or signature is missing, and 5 points if the styling or positioning is incorrect. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle various input situations (empty content, very long text, special characters, etc.) and maintain proper display. Check if the SVG includes text wrapping for long content and handles special characters correctly. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no edge cases are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Hover effects or animations 2. Interactive elements 3. Dynamic content resizing 4. Creative use of SVG filters or gradients). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or styling definitions 2. Excessive nesting or grouping that complicates the structure 3. Fancy effects that affect rendering performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating layout/styling/content generation), reusable components, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if inline styling is overused instead of defined attributes; deduct 5 points if similar elements have duplicated definitions instead of reusing patterns; deduct 5 points if the code lacks proper organization or comments. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (adhering to the specified color scheme) 2) Proper layout spacing (consistent margins and padding) 3) Professional typography (proper font sizes and weights). Deduct 3 points for each inconsistent visual element, 5 points for deviations from the specified color scheme, and 5 points for chaotic text layout or improper spacing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the text handling properly implemented?
checklist.description: Judge whether the text implementation meets requirements: 1) All text uses Arial font 2) Titles are paired with appropriate emojis 3) Content wraps automatically based on length 4) Maintains consistent spacing 5) No text overlaps or obscures other elements. Deduct 2 points for each missing text requirement, with specific attention to text wrapping implementation which is critical for SVG. The full score is 10 points.
